趨.definition: to hasten; to hurry; to walk fast; to approach; to tend towards; to converge

趨之若鶩.definition: to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable; an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase

趨冷.definition: (of economic activity, international relations etc) to cool

趨利避害.definition: (idiom) to make the most of the benefits while avoiding adverse effects

趨化作用.definition: chemotaxis (movement of leukocytes under chemical stimulus)

趨吉避凶.definition: to seek luck and avoid calamity (idiom)

趨奉.definition: to fawn on; to kiss up to

趨炎附勢.definition: to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power; social climbing

趨緩.definition: to slow down; to ease up; to abate; slowdown; downturn

趨近.definition: to approach (a numerical value); to converge to a limit (in calculus); convergence
